column4: i'm trying to mount a thumb drive and get the following errors: mount: no medium found mount: no medium found error: could not execute pmount anyone have an idea?
what is the exact commant you enter?
maybe the device is not supported. what kind of thumbdrive is it exactly?
try to open a terminal and type "sudo modprobe usb-storage"
that is good. no errors is good
is it plugged in and turned on?
what is the filesystem? fat32?
now that usb-storage is loaded, unplug and plug it in again. if you're in gnome it might detect it properly now
try "dmesg" and see if you have any "sda: " or "usb-storage:"
if you are lucky you should see something like this "usb-storage: device found at 2" and  "sda: sda1"
line 282 in the pastebin show that the name of the device is sdb. let's try to mount it. "sudo mkdir /media/sandisk" "sudo mount -t vfat /dev/sdb /media/sandisk"
maybe it is not formatted
can you run "gparted" and see if there is a filesystem on the disk?
on the top right corner you should be able to select the disk
/dev/sdb
oh, you've got two thumbdrives connected?
hmmm. dmesg say that sdb exist at least.
does "sudo fdisk -l" show the device?
maybe it need special drivers. can't really say. dmesg say that sdb is there but also that "sda: read capacity failed". strange
have you seen any bug reports on google for that specifik sandisk?
i'm out of ideas.
np. good luck
